treatment.description: Leaves: petiole 1–6(–10) cm; blade 1–4 cm. Inflorescences scapose, 20–60 cm, minutely stipitate-glandular; bracts subtending pedicels scalelike. Flowers: hypanthium cylindric to obconic, 3–4 mm, stipitate-glandular; sepals rounded-oblong to ovate, 1–1.5 mm, apex rounded, long stipitate-glandular; petals erect, elliptic to narrowly spatulate with long claw, unlobed, 4–5(–6) mm; stamens included, 0.5 mm; stigmas sessile. Capsules elliptic, 6.5–10 mm. Seeds 50–100, 1–1.4 mm. 2n = 14.
treatment.discussion: Conimitella williamsii is found in the Rocky Mountains.
